events.name: eds-icon-clicked
events.description: Fired when a icon is clicked

properties.name: applyCss
properties.description: Using [applyCss]="true", elements inside the svg (path, polygon, etc.) can be extended via component CSS to apply animations. This works even if inner elements have declared attributes.

properties.name: baseSvgPath
properties.description:
Icons are stored in the EDS assets directory. When using them in an application, copy them to
a directory of your chosing and update this path to reflect their location

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Name and/or filename used for referencing SVG file, used to generate both name and src properties

properties.name: isAnimated
properties.description: Boolean that sets the animation class, this is set to false as a default.

properties.name: isDarkTheme
properties.description: Forces icon to render in a lights-off theme

properties.name: loadMethod
properties.description: Specify desired load method (src, name, or string). In testing, we've found that preloading with "name" has slight performance advantages.

properties.name: stretch
properties.description: Should the svg stretch to fill it's container

properties.name: svgString
properties.description: If loading method is string, use this property to add the svg via this string

properties.name: svgStyle
properties.description: Specify any styles to be applied to the svg (e.g. height, width, padding, fill color)

properties.name: title
properties.description: This property can be used to specify a custom title for icon

EDSIcon.description:
The eds-icon is a web component. It is used to render svg icons which
can be easily customized by CSS.
EDSIcon.name: Icon
EDSIcon.usage:
Some svg icon files which do not have size dimensions specified may not render.
If the svg source file does not define width and height, we recommend seting them
explicitly to suite your needs via the `svgStyle` input, e.g.:

```
   svgStyle: { width.px: '20', height.px: '30'}
```

The following CSS variables are available for styling :

CSS Variable | Description
:----------------|:-------------
--eds-icon-color | Color for the icon

events.name: eds-icon-clicked
events.description: Fired when a icon is clicked
